translation: Ritual Procedure for Recitation of the Vairocana-abhisaṃbodhi-tantra

source_sentence: 淨行護持品(亦云增益守護清淨行品第二)　至誠恭敬一心住，　　五輪投地而作禮，　歸命十方正等覺，　　三世一切具三身，　歸命一切大乘法，　　歸命不退菩提眾，　歸命諸明真實言，　　歸命一切諸密契，　以身、口、意清淨業，　　慇懃無量恭敬禮。
translation: Chapter on Safeguarding Pure Conduct (also called Chapter 2 of the Chapter on Safeguarding Pure Conduct) With utmost sincerity and respect, he abides with one mind, throws his five wheels to the ground, pays homage, vows to the correct perfect enlightenment in the ten directions, vows to all the three bodies, vows to all the great vehicle dharmas, vows to the nonretrogressing bodhisattvas, vows to the true and genuine words, vows to all the esoteric codes, and venerates with immeasurable respect the pure activities of body, speech, and thought.

source_sentence: 歸命方便真言曰：「唵　曩　麼　薩　婆　怛　他(去)　蘖　哆(去)　迦　野嚩(去)　枳質(二合)　跢　播　那　伴　陀　喃　迦　路弭」　右膝著地合爪掌，　　思惟說悔先罪業：「我由無明所積集，　　身、口、意業造眾罪，　貪欲恚癡覆心故，　　於佛、正法、賢聖僧、　父母二師、善知識，　　及以無量眾生所，　無始生死流轉中，　　具造極重無盡罪。
translation: They say, "In the name of the buddhas of nonretrogression, I vow to all the mystical tokens, venerating them with immeasurable respect and deference with pure actions of body, speech, and mind." Putting his right knee on the ground and putting his palm together, he reflects and explains the sins that came before him, "As a result of the accumulation of ignorance and the many sins caused by actions of body, speech, and thought, and because my mind is hindered by craving, ill-will, and delusion, I've committed an exceedingly heavy and inexhaustible number of sins against the Buddha, the right teaching, noble beings, parents, teachers, and good teachers, as well as countless other sentient beings in the cycle of birth-and-death since the beginning.

source_sentence: 親對十方現在佛，　　悉皆懺悔不復作。」
translation: They all personally confronted the present buddhas in the ten directions and repented and didn't do it again."

source_sentence: 出罪方便真言曰：「唵(一)　薩　婆　播　跛(二)　薩叵(二合)　吒(半音)(三)　那訶　曩(四)　跋　惹囉(二合)　野(五)　莎　訶」「南無十方三世佛，　　三種常身正法藏，　勝願菩提大心眾，　　我今皆悉正歸依。」
translation: The verbal expression for the skillful expulsion of sins is, "Om (1) sarva-prabhāsa (2) sarva-rāja (2) sarva-rāja (3) nahā-rāja (4) vajra-rāja (2) nāga (5) sahā-rāja." "Homage to the three buddhas of the ten directions, the three kinds of eternal bodies of the true dharma treasure house, and the great minded multitude of those who have superior aspirations for enlightenment, I now correctly take refuge in them all."

source_sentence: 歸依方便真言曰：「唵　薩　婆　勃　陀　步　地　薩　怛[口*梵](二合)　捨羅　[哧*皮]　蘖　唓(車夜)　弭　跋　惹羅(二合)　達　麼嘻唎(二合、入)」「我淨此身離諸垢，　　及與三世身、口、意，　過於大海剎塵數，　　奉獻一切諸如來。」
translation: The prayer of the method of taking refuge says, "Om sarva-buddha-buddhi-saṃtâ[mouth*bha](verse) śāla [giggle*pi] tiller-pa (chāya) vaipulya (verse) da mahīrī (verse)" "I purify this body and rid it of all pollution, and I offer it up with the bodies, speech, and mind of the three worlds, which exceed the number of dust particles in the great ocean, to all the tathāgatas."

source_sentence: 施身方便真言曰：「唵　薩　嚩　怛　他(去)　蘖　哆(去)　補　惹　跋羅(二合)伐　[口*栗]哆(二合)　曩(去)　夜　怛麼　喃　儞　利夜哆　夜　弭　薩　婆　哆　他(去)　蘖　跢枳哆始柘(二合)　地　底　瑟吒(二合)　擔　薩　婆　跢　他(去)蘖　跢　枳惹(二合)　南　謎　阿　尾　捨　覩」「淨菩提心勝願寶，　　我今起發濟群生，　生苦等集所纏繞，　　及與無知所害身，　救攝歸依令解脫，　　常當利益諸含識。」
translation: 施身方便真言曰：「唵　薩　嚩　怛　他(去)　蘖　哆(去)　補　惹　跋羅(二合)伐　[口*栗]哆(二合)　曩(去)　夜　怛麼　喃　儞　利夜哆　夜　弭　薩　婆　哆　他(去)　蘖　跢枳哆始柘(二合)　地　底　瑟吒(二合)　擔　薩　婆　跢　他(去)蘖　跢　枳惹(二合)　南　謎　阿　尾　捨　覩」「淨菩提心勝願寶，　　我今起發濟群生，　生苦等集所纏繞，　　及與無知所害身，　救攝歸依令解脫，　　常當利益諸含識。」

source_sentence: 「唵　步　地　質　多　姥　怛播(二合)　那　夜　弭」「十方無量世界中，　　諸正遍知大海眾，　種種善巧方便力，　　及諸佛子為群生，　諸有所修福業等，　　我今一切皆隨喜。」
translation: "Om buddhi tathāgata mo (dharma) tambana yama," he said, "Now, in measureless worlds in the ten directions, I delight in all the oceans of correct universal knowledge, the various kinds of skillful means, and the meritorious actions cultivated by the sons of the Buddha for the sake of sentient beings."

source_sentence: 隨喜方便真言曰：「唵　薩　嚩　怛　他(去)　蘖　多　補　儜　枳惹(二合)曩(去)　弩　慕　那　曩　布　惹　謎　伽　三　姥那羅(二合)　娑叵(二合)　囉　拏　三　麼　曳　吽」「我今勸請諸如來，　　菩提大心救世者，　唯願普於十方界，　　恒以大雲降法雨。」
translation: The accompanying skillful recitation says, "Om sarva tathāgata (departed), tiller tātapuṇḍa (departed), nun muṇḍa (departed), anna puṇḍa (departed), mystery ga, sa mo nara (departed), sama (departed), rā na (departed), sa mah (departed), and un mah." "Now, I'd like to encourage the tathāgatas to save the world with the great mind of enlightenment, wishing that it would rain down the Dharma with great clouds throughout the ten directions."

source_sentence: 勸請方便真言曰：「唵　薩　婆　怛　他(去)　蘖　跢　悌曳(二合)　沙　拏布　惹　謎　伽　三　姥　那羅(二合)　沙叵(二合)　囉拏　三　麼　曳　吽」「願令凡夫所住處，　　速捨眾苦所集身，　當得至於無垢地，　　安住清淨法界體。」
translation: 勸請方便真言曰：「唵　薩　婆　怛　他(去)　蘖　跢　悌曳(二合)　沙　拏布　惹　謎　伽　三　姥　那羅(二合)　沙叵(二合)　囉拏　三　麼　曳　吽」「願令凡夫所住處，　　速捨眾苦所集身，　當得至於無垢地，　　安住清淨法界體。」

source_sentence: 「唵　薩　婆　怛　他(去)　蘖　多　捺　悌曳　灑　夜弭　薩　婆　薩　怛嚩(二合)　呬　哆　[口*栗]他　野　達麼　駄　覩　悉[口*體](他以反)(二合)　[口*底]　[口*栗]婆(二合)　嚩　覩」「所修種種眾善業，　　利益一切諸有情，　我今盡皆正迴向，　　除生死苦至菩提。」
translation: "Om sarva tantra (departed) tiller tada na ti hai saya mo sarva sarva tantra (dichotomy) fretting do [mou]thano dharma da mo dharma tu sis [mou*thi] (dichotomy) [mou*dhi] [mou*dhi] [mou*dhi] po (dichotomy) tu" "The various good actions that I've cultivated to benefit all sentient beings, I now correctly dedicate them all to ridding them of the suffering of birth-and-death and bringing them to enlightenment."

source_sentence: 迴向方便真言曰：「唵　薩　婆　怛　他(去)　蘖　哆(去)　嚩　枳質　多(二合)儞　利夜　哆曩　補　惹　謎　伽　三　姥那囉(二合)　娑叵(二合)　囉　拏　三　摩　曳　吽」入佛三昧耶契：　為淨三業垢，　　結三昧耶契。
translation: The true saying of the method of dedication is, "Om sarvattha (departed) tiller do (departed) vajra khikṣita (departed) niraya dāna puja rudgata sa mo na na na sa mo hye un." The samaya protocol for entering Buddhahood: To purify the stain of the three activities, he forms a samaya protocol.

source_sentence: 先合定慧手，　　並建二空輪，　遍觸諸支分，　　誦持真實語。
translation: First, he joins his hands in meditation and wisdom, builds the two wheels of emptiness, touches all the parts, and recites the true words.

source_sentence: 入佛三昧耶明曰：「曩　麼　薩　婆　怛　他(去)　蘖　帝　頻庾(二合)　尾捨嚩(二合)　穆　契　頻也(二合)　唵　阿　三　謎底哩(二合)　三　謎　三　麼　曳　娑嚩(二合)　賀」法界生契：　般若三昧手，　　俱作金剛拳，　二空在掌中，　　風幢皆正直。
translation: The ritual for entering the Buddha's concentration says, "An sabta tathā (departed) tiller, ti ti yu (second merge), viśvabhū (second merge), muche, tiya (second merge), om a sa sa mudiri (second merge), sa mudiri (third merge), sa mudiri (third merge), sa yu (third merge), and mo shya (third merge)."

source_sentence: 以契置額上，　　繞身向下散，　觀身等法界，　　無垢如虛空。
translation: Placing the deed on his forehead, he wraps it around his body and spreads it downward, observing the body as the Dharma realm and the undefiled space like space.

source_sentence: 法界生真言曰：「曩　麼　三　曼　跢　勃　馱　喃　達　磨　馱　覩娑嚩(二合)　皤　嚩　句　訶吽(二合)」　金剛薩埵契，　　結金剛智印，　止觀手相背，　　地、水、火、風輪。
translation: The true words for the arising of the Dharma realm are, "*Anima samanta-buddha-nirdeśa-dharma-dunda-tuṣa-saṃsādha(bis), 'Vajrasattva deeds,' forming the adamantine wisdom seal, Zhiguan's hands are placed behind each other, and the earth, water, fire, and wind wheels are turned.

source_sentence: 左右互相持，　　二空各旋轉，　合於慧掌中，　　是名為法輪，　最勝吉祥契。
translation: Holding his left and right sides to each other, he rotates each of them in emptiness and combines them in the palm of his wisdom, which is called the wheel of the Dharma and the most auspicious deed.

source_sentence: 金剛薩埵真言曰：「曩　麼　三　曼　跢　跋　惹囉(二合)　[哧*皮]　唵　跋惹囉　怛麼(二合)　句　訶吽」　誦此真言已，　　當住於等引，　諦觀我此身，　　即是執金剛。
translation: The true words of Vajrasattva are, "An, sa, ma, pa, jarā [giggle*pi], o, vajarā, tamā, k, ha, and un." After reciting these true words, he should abide in equipoise and truly observe this body of mine, which is the Vajra he holds.

source_sentence: 甲冑金剛契，　　先作三補吒，　止觀二風輪，　　糺持火輪上。
translation: He first makes a tripiṭaka, stops and looks at the two wind-wheels, and carries the fire-wheel on his head.

source_sentence: 附中指上節，　　二空自相並，　而在於掌中，　　火輪想囕字。
translation: Attaching the top knuckle of his middle finger, he holds the two spaces together, and in his palm, he conceives of the letter Typhus in the fire wheel.

source_sentence: 囕字如明珠，　　置之於頂上。
translation: The letter 'A' is like a bright pearl, and it's placed on top of the head.

source_sentence: 甲冑真言曰：「曩　麼　三　曼　跢　跋　惹囉(二合)　[哧*皮]　唵　跋惹囉(二合)　迦　嚩　者　吽」　次念無堪忍，　　能制諸大障，　囕字赫光焰，　　環繞周嚴身。
translation: The true chant of Kapphiṇa says, "An omen, saman, varjarā [giggle*pi], omen, varjarā [giggle*pi], kāśyapa, and un." Next, he chants, "Wukan forbearance, which restrains the great hindrances, and the radiant flame of the letter cha, which encircles his body.

source_sentence: 無堪忍真言曰：「曩　麼　薩　婆　怛　他(去)　蘖　帝　頻庾(二合)　薩婆　播　野　尾　蘖　帝　頻也(二合)　微　濕嚩(二合)目　契　頻也(二合)　薩　婆　他(去)　訶吽(二合)　佉吽(二合)洛　訖叉(二合)　摩　訶(去)　嚩　麗　薩　婆怛　佗(去)　蘖　哆　補　儜也(二合)　儞　惹　帝　吽吽　怛喇　吒　怛喇吒　阿　跛囉(二合)　底　訶帝　娑嚩(二合)　訶」供養儀式品第三　先結三昧耶，　　次不動刀契，　乃奉閼伽水。
translation: 無堪忍真言曰：「曩　麼　薩　婆　怛　他(去)　蘖　帝　頻庾(二合)　薩婆　播　野　尾　蘖　帝　頻也(二合)　微　濕嚩(二合)目　契　頻也(二合)　薩　婆　他(去)　訶吽(二合)　佉吽(二合)洛　訖叉(二合)　摩　訶(去)　嚩　麗　薩　婆怛　佗(去)　蘖　哆　補　儜也(二合)　儞　惹　帝　吽吽　怛喇　吒　怛喇吒　阿　跛囉(二合)　底　訶帝　娑嚩(二合)　訶」供養儀式品第三　先結三昧耶，　　次不動刀契，　乃奉閼伽水。

source_sentence: 復獻金剛座，　次奉香華等，　　去垢無動尊。
translation: He then presents the vajra throne, followed by incense, flowers, and so forth, to the venerable Immaculate Conception.

source_sentence: 現前觀覽字，　　去而一肘間，　熾焰朝日暉。
translation: He then offers incense, flowers, and so forth, the Vairocana, the immovable, immaculate, and unmoving honored one.

source_sentence: 念誦真實義，　能除一切障。
translation: Recitation of the true meaning removes all hindrances.

source_sentence: 先自淨心地，　復淨道場地，　　悉皆除過患，　其相如虛空。
translation: It first purifies his own mind and then purifies the site of the path, all of which are freed from faults and have appearances like space.

source_sentence: 下觀訶風輪，　黑光焰流布。
translation: He then contemplates the black light of the Ha wind wheel, which spreads like a flame.

source_sentence: 次水輪嚩字，　其色如乳海。
translation: Next, he observes the word va, a water wheel whose color is like an ocean of milk.

source_sentence: 次地觀阿字，　四向黃金色。
translation: The next observes the letter a at the ground level, which is yellow-gold in four directions.

source_sentence: 上四字觀門，　皆先誦歸命。
translation: These four observances of the word a precede the chant, "Acknowledge your life.

source_sentence: 「曩　莫　三　曼　跢　勃　駄　喃(下同)謂　覽　訶嚩　阿」　自此金剛輪，　　普現眾法相，　諦觀牟尼主，　　坐百寶蓮華。
translation: "Thus, the vajra wheel universally displays the characteristics of all dharmas, and the truly observant Muni-lord sits on a lotus with a hundred jewels.

source_sentence: 環涌眾妙華，　　億億蓮華衛，　各於蓮華上，　　無量威德尊。
translation: Ringed by a multitude of marvelous flowers, billions of lotus guardians stand atop each lotus flower, honored with measureless authority.

source_sentence: 在天廣殿中，　　殿寶柱行列，　幢幡、華鬘等，　　賢瓶與遏伽。
translation: In the vast celestial palace, the palace's jeweled pillars are arrayed, and there are banners, streamers, and other flower garlands, vases of goodness, and jars of curl.

source_sentence: 普雨香華雲，　　周流珍寶聚，　光網垂輕蓋，　　互映諸妙像。
translation: Clouds of fragrant flowers rain down everywhere, surrounded by a cluster of precious treasures, and nets of light hang down to reflect the marvelous images.

source_sentence: 殿聳高廣樹，　　明徹遍法界，　偃蓋布瓊榦，　　華葉普芬馥。
translation: The palace rises above a tall, broad tree, its light penetrating the Dharma realm, its shrouded lid spreads like a pine tree trunk, and its flowers and leaves are fragrant.

source_sentence: 菓實千般秀，　　繽紛羅法筵，　巧色摩尼燈，　　旁曳天衣降。
translation: Fruit of a thousand varieties is displayed, the Dharma feast is decorated, and the skillfully colored maṇi lamp is trailed by celestial robes.

source_sentence: 芳藥含滋味，　　香饍備珍味，　天樂奏妙音，　　諧韻悅意響。
translation: Fragrant medicines contain flavors, fragrant foods prepare rare foods, heavenly music plays marvelous sounds, and harmonious chords delight the senses.

source_sentence: 雲臺無齊限，　　妙呈眾供具，　自力佛加備，　　及遍法界心。
translation: There's no limit to the number of clouds or platforms, but they present a multitude of offerings, are prepared by the Buddha's own power, and pervade the mind of the Dharma realm.

source_sentence: 但誦此真言，　　充廣大供養。
translation: Simply reciting this true chant fills a vast offering.

source_sentence: 虛空藏明妃真言曰：「曩　麼　薩　婆　怛　他(去)　蘖　帝　頻庾(二合)　尾捨縛　穆　契　頻也(二合)　唵　薩　婆　他(去)　欠搵(住沒反)　蘖　帝　薩叵　囉　呬　[牟*含]　誐　誐　曩劍　婆嚩(二合)　賀」　一切法不生，　　自性本寂故，　想念此真言，　　阿字置其中。
translation: The Ākāśagarbha's bright consort truly says, "In the past, it was sarvattha (departed), tiller, di (two joined), vaiśvah, muche, di (two joined), oṃ sarvattha (departed), yoṭṭ (śuboṭ), tiller, di sama, rāh, fre [mu*han], ga ga, ga, an kam po (two joined), ha." All things don't arise, so their own nature is originally quiescent.

source_sentence: 轉成大日尊，　　普現塵沙眾，　光焰遍法界，　　隨性令開悟。
translation: He becomes the great sun honored one, universally manifesting a multitude of dust motes, his light blazing across the Dharma realm, and bringing about enlightenment according to his nature.

source_sentence: 大蓮華王上，　　諦想牟尼尊，　於尊白豪間，　　復現於明主，　諦觀明主已，　　方作加持法。
translation: The great lotus king then contemplates the venerable Muni, who's the honored one among the white hosts, and again appears as the lord of light, and after truly observing the lord of light, then he performs the ritual of empowerment.

source_sentence: 大日如來心真言曰：「曩　莫　三　曼　多　勃　駄　喃　阿」慧手金拳置於眉閒上。
translation: The Tathāgata's true mantra is, "Anā mo samantabhadra padañjana," and he places his golden fist of wisdom on his eyebrows.

source_sentence: 如來毫相真言曰：「曩　麼　三　曼　多　勃　馱　喃　阿(去聲急呼)　痕　惹(急呼)」次諸尊真言，普通種子心曰：「南　麼　三　曼　多　勃　馱　喃　迦」　契經所說迦字門，　　一切諸法無造作。
translation: The Tathāgata's true mantra of the tuft of hair says, "Anātman Samantabhadra-dhāraṇḍa (deprecatory shout)," followed by the true mantra of the honored ones and the ordinary seed mind says, "Anātman Samantabhadra-dhāraṇḍa-kāya," the Sanskrit entry for ka that's explained in the sūtras, in which all things are uncreated.

source_sentence: 真陀摩尼寶王印，　　定慧五輪互相交。
translation: The seal of the maṇi-jewel king of true dharmas intersects the five wheels of meditation and wisdom.

source_sentence: 金剛合掌之標式，　　普遍一切菩薩法。
translation: The standard form of the vajra clasping his hands universally applies all bodhisattva teachings.

source_sentence: 一切諸菩薩真言曰：「曩　麼　三　曼　多　勃　馱　喃(一)　薩　婆　他(二)微　沫　底(三)　微　枳　羅　儜(上)(四)　達　摩　馱　睹[嗨-每+(臼/工)]　闍　多(五)　參　參　訶(六)　莎　訶」　不動尊去垢，　　辟除使光顯，　為息一切障，　　住火生三昧。
translation: The true words of all the bodhisattvas are, "*Nāgas samantabhadra(1) sarvata(2) micromandi(3) michelia(3)(4) dharmadhātu[hi-per+(u/work)] jāti(5) sansōha(6) sahā." The Acolyte of Akṣobhya removes pollution, refutes it so that it shines, calms all hindrances, and abides in fire-generating samādhi.

source_sentence: 不動使者真言曰(用慧刀印諸供物名為去垢)：「曩　麼　三　曼　哆　跋　惹羅(二合)　[哧*皮]　戰　荼摩　訶(去)　嚧　沙　拏　沙叵(二合)　吒　野　吽　怛囉吒(半)　訶吽(二合)　摩吽(二合)」方隅結界皆用慧刀。
translation: The messenger of Akṣobhya's true teaching is (to seal offerings with a knife of wisdom, which is called "removing defilement"), "An and then Samantabhadra [giggle*pi] caṇḍamāha (depart), śrāna, samaṇa, ṭāya, un, tārāṣa (half), ha'un (half), mahāmā (half)," and the knife of wisdom is used at all boundary crossings.

source_sentence: 次作召請法，　　堅固金剛縛，　直舒二風輪，　　俛屈其上節。
translation: The next invocation is to firmly bind the vajra, straighten the two wind-wheels, and bend their upper joints.

source_sentence: 是名金剛鉤，　　能召一切眾，　聖依願而來，　　不違本誓願。
translation: This is called the vajra hook, which summons all sentient beings, and the sages come according to their vows, not contrary to their original vows.

source_sentence: 召請聖眾真言曰：「曩　麼　三　曼　多　勃　馱　喃(一)　阿(去、急呼)　薩　婆怛囉(引、二合)　鉢囉(二合)　[口*底]　訶　諦(二)　怛　他(引)　蘖黨　矩　奢(三)　菩　提　淅　[口*履]耶(二合)　鉢　[口*履]　布囉　迦(四)　莎　訶」　次奉三昧耶，　　具以真言契，　契相如前說，　　諸三昧耶教。
translation: The invocation of the noble ones goes, "Anon, samantabhadra (1) ā (go, shout) sarvatara (2) pala (2) [mouth*die] ha (2) tantra (2) kuśa (3) bodhisattva (2) pala (2) pala (4) sah (4) sah (5)." Next, he offers a samaya, complete with a true-language contract, the characteristics of which are as explained above, and the teachings of the samayas.

source_sentence: 三昧耶真言曰：「曩　麼　三　曼　多　勃　駄　喃(一)　阿　三　迷(二)怛履　三　迷(三)　三　摩　曳(四)　莎　訶」　次獻遏伽水，　　奉諸善逝者，　用浴無垢身。
translation: The true words of the samaya are, "Anāsamantaphadra(a) āsamyak(b) trāyastriṃśa(c) samāpatti(d) sahā." Next, he offers water of curdha to those who are well gone to bathe his undefiled body.

source_sentence: 閼伽真言曰：「曩　麼　三　曼　多　勃　馱　喃　哦　哦　曩　三麼　三麼　莎嚩(二合)　賀」　次奉蓮華座，　　遍置一切處，　二空與地輪，　　聚合以為臺，　餘輪各相遠，　　是即蓮華印。
translation: He then consecrates the lotus seat, placing it everywhere, combining the two wheels of emptiness and the earth as a platform, and distancing the other wheels from each other, which is the lotus seal.

source_sentence: 如來座真言曰：「曩　麼　三　曼　哆　勃　駄　喃　阿(引聲急呼)」　復次當辟除，　　以大慧刀印。
translation: The Tathāgata's throne truly says, "Nāgas, samantabhadra, and dharma (leading to a sharp cry)." Next, he removes them with the seal of the great sword of wisdom.

source_sentence: 聖不動真言，　　當觀同於彼。
translation: The holy Akṣobhya-sūtra will be observed to be the same as that.

source_sentence: 最勝金剛焰，　　燒諸障無餘，　次即當轉作，　　金剛薩埵身。
translation: The most excellent adamantine flame burns away the hindrances without remainder, and then it's transformed into the body of Vajrasattva.

source_sentence: 真言印相應，　　遍布諸支分。
translation: The seal of the true words is associated with and spreads throughout the branches.

source_sentence: 金剛種子心曰：「曩　麼　三　曼　多　勃　馱　喃　鑁」　念此真實義，　　諸法離言說。
translation: The mind of the adamantine seed says, "Nāgârjuna samantabhadra-pratyutpannas," remembering this true and real meaning, all things are free from language.

source_sentence: 以具印等故，　　即同執金剛。
translation: Because it has a seal and so forth, it's the same as holding the vajra.

source_sentence: 當知彼印相，　　水輪內五股。
translation: You should know that this seal has the characteristics of a water wheel with five internal strands.

source_sentence: 金剛薩埵真言曰：「曩　麼　三　曼　多　伐　折囉　赧(一)　戰　拏　麼訶(引)　[口*路]　沙　赧(平)(二)　吽(或用三昧手作半金剛印)」　次當周遍身，　　被服金剛鎧，　身語之密印，　　前已依法說。
translation: The true words of Vajrasattva are, "An, 'Mātri māntavar,' 'Jelā blush,' (a) 'Caṇḍamāha,' (b) 'Un,' (or he may use his samādhi hand to make a half-vajra seal)." Next, he should circumambulate his body, put on the vajra armor, and set out with the esoteric seal of body speech, as explained above in the teaching.

source_sentence: 次佉字具點，　　以置於頂上，　思惟此真言，　　諸法如虛空。
translation: Next, he places the word kha with a dot on top of his head and contemplates this true saying, 'All things are like space.'

source_sentence: 彼真言曰：「南　麼　三　曼　多　勃　馱　喃　欠(先轉此字作金剛薩埵身)」　次應一心住，　　摧伏諸魔印，　智者應普轉，　　真言共相應。
translation: The verbal expression is, "Nam mam mantra buddha hau (first turning this character into the body of Vajrasattva)." Next, he should abide with one mind, subdue the signs of Māra, and the wise should universally change them, truly saying the same thing.

source_sentence: 諸有惡心者，　　當見遍此地，　金剛熾焰光。
translation: Those with evil intentions will see the blazing adamantine light that pervades this place.

source_sentence: 當以智慧手，　而作金剛拳，　　正直舒風輪，　加於白毫際，　　如毘俱知形，　是則彼標幟。
translation: With the hand of wisdom, he'll make a vajra fist, correctly straighten it, extend its wind-wheel, and place it at the tip of a white tuft of hair, like the shape of a Vairocana, which is its standard.

source_sentence: 此印名大印，　念之除眾魔。
translation: This seal is called the great seal, and its recitation removes Māra.

source_sentence: 毘俱胝真言曰：「曩　莫　三　曼　多　勃　馱　南　薩　婆　皤　耶怛囉(二合)　薩　寧　吽　娑叵(二合)　吒　耶　娑嚩(二合)訶」　次用難堪忍，　　密印及真言，　而用結周界，　　威猛無能覩。
translation: The true words of Vikramāditya are, "An Mo Samantagandha Bodhidharma, Sa Sa Va Ra Ra Ra Sa Nying, Un Sa Mātāra, Ya Sa Va Ha." Next, he applies the seal of forbearance, a mysterious seal, and a true chant, and it's used to form a boundary that's so powerful it can't be seen.

source_sentence: 先以三補吒，　　風輪在於掌，　二空及地輪，　　內屈猶如鉤。
translation: First, he takes the three patchwork wheels, placing the wind wheel in his palm and the two air and earth wheels, which are bent inward like hooks.

source_sentence: 火輪合為峯，　　開散其水輪，　旋轉指十方，　　是名結大界。
translation: The fire wheel combines into a peak, and the water wheel opens and dissipates, pointing in a revolving circle in ten directions, which is called the great fetter.

source_sentence: 無能堪忍真言曰：「南　麼　三　曼　多　勃　馱　喃(一)　麗　魯　補　[口*履]微　矩　麗(二)　莎　訶」　或以不動尊，　　成辦一切事，　護身處令淨，　　結諸方界等。
translation: The verbal expression for the Dharma of incapability says, "Nan mamatha buddhān(a) rupu [kuṇḍu] nuṣkula(b) sahā." Perhaps the Acala accomplishes all tasks, purifies his body, and binds the various realms together.

source_sentence: 不動尊種子心曰：「南　麼　三　曼　多　伐　折囉　赧　悍」　結彼慧刀印，　　普皆遍灑之，　是諸香華等，　　所辦供養具。
translation: The Akṣobhya seed mind says, "Namasamantapārjagṛha" and combines it with the seal of the sword of wisdom, which is sprinkled everywhere with fragrant flowers and other things that are used to make offerings.

source_sentence: 復一切遍置，　　清淨法界心，　所謂覽字門，　　如前所開示。
translation: They are also all pervasively placed to purify the mind of the Dharma realm, which is called the approach of insight, as explained above.

source_sentence: 塗香真言曰：「南　麼　三　曼　多　勃　馱　喃(一)　微　輸(上)　馱健　杜(引)　嗢婆(二合)　嚩　莎　訶」散華真言曰：「南　麼　三　曼　多　勃　馱　南(一)　摩　訶(引)　昧怛[口*履]也(三合)(二)　毘庾(二合)　嗢蘖　帝(三)　莎　訶」焚香真言曰：「南　麼　三　曼　多　勃　馱　喃(一)　達　摩　馱怛嚩(二合)　拏　蘖　帝(二)　莎　訶」燃燈真言曰：「南　麼　三　曼　多　勃　馱　喃(一)　怛　他　蘖　多喇旨(二合)(二)　薩叵(二合)　囉　儜　縛　婆(去)　娑　娜(三)伽　伽　猱　陀　里耶(二合)　莎　訶」獻食真言曰：「南　麼　三　曼　多　勃　馱　喃(一)　阿　囉　囉　迦囉　囉(二)　末　隣　捺　娜　弭　沫　隣　捺　泥(三)摩　訶(引)　沫　履(四)　莎　訶」　諸餘供養具，　　所應奉獻者，　依隨此法則，　　淨以不動尊。
translation: 塗香真言曰：「南　麼　三　曼　多　勃　馱　喃(一)　微　輸(上)　馱健　杜(引)　嗢婆(二合)　嚩　莎　訶」散華真言曰：「南　麼　三　曼　多　勃　馱　南(一)　摩　訶(引)　昧怛[口*履]也(三合)(二)　毘庾(二合)　嗢蘖　帝(三)　莎　訶」焚香真言曰：「南　麼　三　曼　多　勃　馱　喃(一)　達　摩　馱怛嚩(二合)　拏　蘖　帝(二)　莎　訶」燃燈真言曰：「南　麼　三　曼　多　勃　馱　喃(一)　怛　他　蘖　多喇旨(二合)(二)　薩叵(二合)　囉　儜　縛　婆(去)　娑　娜(三)伽　伽　猱　陀　里耶(二合)　莎　訶」獻食真言曰：「南　麼　三　曼　多　勃　馱　喃(一)　阿　囉　囉　迦囉　囉(二)　末　隣　捺　娜　弭　沫　隣　捺　泥(三)摩　訶(引)　沫　履(四)　莎　訶」　諸餘供養具，　　所應奉獻者，　依隨此法則，　　淨以不動尊。

source_sentence: 當合定慧掌，　　五輪互相叉，　是則持眾物，　　普通供養印。
translation: Clasping his palms in meditation and wisdom, he folds his five circles over each other, then holds all the things in common, making the seal of offerings.

source_sentence: 復作心儀式，　　所獻皆充滿，　此方及餘方，　　大供莊嚴雲，　各雨諸供物，　　供養十方界。
translation: Again, he performs a mental ritual, filling them all with offerings, making great adorned clouds of offerings in this and other directions, and raining down offerings to the ten directions.

source_sentence: 諸佛及菩薩，　　以空藏通印，　如法所修事，　　積集諸功德，　迴向成悉地，　　為利諸眾生。
translation: The buddhas and bodhisattvas use the seal of the supernormal power of the store of emptiness to do what's right, accumulate merit, and dedicate it to the accomplishment of the stage of accomplishment for the benefit of sentient beings.

source_sentence: 若諸真言人，　　此生求悉地，　先依法持誦，　　所為既終竟。
translation: If people of the true language seek to attain this stage in this life, they first recite it according to the teachings, and then they finish what they've done.

source_sentence: 又以持金剛，　　殊勝之諷詠，　供養佛、菩薩，　　當得速成就。
translation: They then make offerings to the buddhas and bodhisattvas by holding the vajra and reciting its extraordinary chant, which will quickly bring about their accomplishment.

source_sentence: 金剛歌詠偈曰：「金剛薩埵攝受故，　　得為無上金剛寶；　金剛言詞歌詠故，　　願成金剛勝事業。」
translation: The verse for the song of the vajras says, "Because the Vajrasattva takes them in, he attains the unsurpassed adamantine treasure; because he sings and chants in the words of the vajras, he wishes to accomplish the excellent work of the vajras."

source_sentence: 轉明妃偈曰：「以我功德所莊嚴，　　及淨法界中出生，　如來神力加持故，　　成就眾生諸義利。
translation: The Verse of Turning the Bright Consort says, "Because I'm adorned by my virtues and born in the pure Dharma realm, the Tathāgata's spiritual power upholds them and accomplishes the various benefits for sentient beings.

source_sentence: 三誦虛空藏轉明，　　密印相如前說也。」
translation: Three recitations of the Ākāśagarbha turn the brightness, and the mysterious seal is as explained above."

source_sentence: 持誦法則品第四
translation: The Fourth Chapter of the Dharma-Conduct of Recitation

source_sentence: 如是具法供養已，　　起利無盡眾生心，　稽首諸佛、聖天等，　　住相應座入三昧。
translation: After making these complete offerings of the Dharma, he gives rise to the intention to benefit endless sentient beings, pays homage to the buddhas and noble gods, and enters samādhi while standing in a concomitant seat.

source_sentence: 四種靜慮之軌儀，　　能令內心生喜樂，　以真實義加持故，　　當得真言成等引。
translation: These four ways of meditation cause joy and happiness in the mind, and because of their true meaning, they will attain the accomplishment of directives based on true speech.

source_sentence: 智者如先所開示，　　現前而觀本所尊，　於其心月圓明中，　　悉皆照見真言字。
translation: As previously instructed, the wise man directly observes the original honored one, and in the full radiance of the moon of his mind, he sees all the words of the true teaching.

source_sentence: 行者應生決定意，　　先當一緣觀本尊，　持彼真言祕密印，　　自作瑜伽本尊像。
translation: Practitioners should give rise to a determined intention, first contemplate the original honored one with one condition, hold the secret seal of that true language, and create their own image of the original yoga honored one.

source_sentence: 由住本地相應身，　　雖少福者亦成就。
translation: Because he abides in the body associated with this place, even though he has little merit, he'll achieve it.

source_sentence: 行者若持誦，　　大毘盧遮那，　正覺真言印，　　當依如是法。
translation: If a practitioner recites the seal of the true words of the Mahāvairocana and the True Enlightenment, he should rely on this teaching.

source_sentence: 大日如來種子心曰：「南　麼　三　曼　多　勃　馱　喃　阿(所謂一切法本不生故，已如前說)」　是中身密印，　　正覺白毫相，　慧手金剛拳，　　而在於眉間。
translation: The Tathāgata's seed mind says, "Nan mamatha buddha a (it means that all dharmas are originally unarisen, as explained above)," which is a medium-body mudrā, a white tuft of hair from Zhengjue, and a wisdom hand with a vajra fist between the eyebrows.

source_sentence: 如來毫相真言曰：「南　麼　三　曼　多　勃　馱　喃(一)　阿(去聲急呼)　痕惹(急呼)」　如前轉阿字，　　而成大日尊，　法力所持故，　　與自身無異。
translation: The Tathāgata's true mantra of the tuft of hair says, "Nan mamatha buddha (a) a (deprecatory acute call) scar (acute call)." He turns the letter a as before and becomes the honored Mahāvairocana, no different from himself because he's sustained by the power of the Dharma.

source_sentence: 住本尊瑜伽，　　加以五支字，　下體及臍上、　　心頂與眉間。
translation: He abides in the yoga of the original honored one, applying the five syllables to his lower body, upper navel, and the top of his heart and between his eyebrows.

source_sentence: 於三摩呬多，　　運想而安立，　以依是法住，　　即同牟尼尊。
translation: He establishes this in the conception of the samākhya, relying on this teaching to abide, which is the same as the venerable Muni.

source_sentence: 阿字加下體，　　金輪瑜伽座；　鑁字加臍上，　　素光大悲水；　覽字加心位，　　赤角智火光；　唅字白毫際，　　黑風自在力；　佉字在頂上，　　五色名大空。
translation: Adding the letter a to the lower body, it's the yoga seat of the golden wheel; adding the letter ā to the navel, it's the water of great compassion with a pure light; adding the word Śākyamuni to the mental level, it's the firelight of red-horned wisdom; adding the word śramaṇa to the white tuft of hair, it's the unimpeded power of the black wind; and placing the word kha on top of the head, it's called the great emptiness of the five colors.

source_sentence: 五字嚴身，　　威德成就，　　熾大慧光，　除眾罪業。
translation: These five characters adorn the body, accomplish authoritative qualities, and blaze with the light of great wisdom, ridding it of all wrongdoing.

source_sentence: 見是人赫，　　天魔軍退。
translation: Seeing this person's prowess, the armies of gods and Māra retreat.

source_sentence: 等大悲空頂，無邊性空不障礙故。
translation: Equally compassionate as the empty summit, their limitless nature is empty because it's not an obstruction.

source_sentence: 如虛空界，離一切分別、無分別；如是，一切智智妙觀平等，離一切分別、無分別故，云無等等也。
translation: Like the realm of space, it's free of all discrimination and nondiscrimination; thus, the marvelous contemplation of the wisdom of all knowables is equal, and it's free of all discrimination and nondiscrimination, which is why it's called peerless.

source_sentence: 因大悲風額，除障智風能開發故。
translation: Because the wind of great compassion is abundant, the wind of removing obstructions to cognition can develop it.

source_sentence: 如風能淨除塵、霧、煙、雲；如是，大智風淨除無明垢穢、煩惱、昏沈等也。
translation: Just as the wind purifies and removes dust, fog, smoke, and clouds, so the wind of great cognition purifies and removes the defilement of ignorance, affliction, and delusion.

source_sentence: 塵大悲火心，三昧慧炬所溫育故。
translation: The mind of the fire of great compassion for dust is tempered by the torch of samādhi and wisdom.

source_sentence: 如火能燒一切薪；如是，一切智火燒無智薪，滅妄業垢，令無遺餘，於無明暗中為大明照也。
translation: Like fire that burns all firewood, the fire of omniscience burns the fire of nescience, destroying the defilement of false activity so that there's nothing left, and providing great illumination in the darkness of ignorance.

source_sentence: 言大悲水臍，功德乳海所滋潤故。
translation: It's called the navel of the water of great compassion because it's nourished by an ocean of milk of merit.

source_sentence: 如水能從高赴下，多有饒益滋潤草木、華菓，本性清淨；如是，如來智水從真言法界流趣世閒，潤諸持生助道之法，成大果實，常以洗濯菩提之心，不令染污也。
translation: Just as water can rise from a high place and descend, giving much benefit and nourishing to plants, trees, flowers, and fruits that are inherently pure, so the Tathāgata's water of wisdom flows from the dharma-realm of true speech to the leisure of the world, nourishing all those who bear the seeds that aid the way and bring about the great fruit that always cleanses the mind of enlightenment and prevents it from being defiled.

source_sentence: 座大悲地界，金剛座下金剛寶地所執持故。
translation: He's seated in the element of great compassion, which is held by the adamantine jeweled ground beneath his vajra throne.

source_sentence: 如地能生萬物，荷負一切世閒不可傾動；如是，一切智地從如來金剛性生，即此生者畢竟無生，能生菩提萬善，執持一切賢聖心地，不可沮壞也。
translation: Just as the ground is capable of producing all things and bears the burden of all worldly leisure, it can't be tilted; thus, the ground of omniscience arises from the Tathāgata's adamantine nature, which is ultimately unborn, produces all the goodness of bodhi, and holds the ground of the minds of all the good and noble ones, which can't be destroyed.

source_sentence: 又於首中置，　　百光遍照王，　眼安無垢字，　　猶燈明顯照。
translation: At the head, he places a hundred lights that universally illuminate the king, and he fixes the word unsullied in his eye like a bright lamp that shines brightly.

source_sentence: 智者觀自體，　　等同如來身，　心月圓明處，　　聲鬘與相應。
translation: A wise person observes their own body as being the same as the Tathāgata's, and where the mind's moon is perfectly shining, it's accompanied by a sound garland.

source_sentence: 字字無閒斷，　　猶如韻鈴鐸，　正等覺真言，　　隨取而受持。
translation: Each word is uninterrupted, like a rhyming bell, and the true words of the perfectly enlightened are taken and held as they are.

source_sentence: 當知此方便，　　速得成悉地。
translation: You should know that this is a method that quickly achieves accomplishment.

source_sentence: 或說異儀軌，　　普通三密門，　若解旋轉者，　　所作皆成就。
translation: Some teach a different ritual, the three ordinary mystical approaches, and if you understand their revolutions, what you do will be accomplished.

source_sentence: 普通種子心真言曰：「南　麼　三　曼　多　勃　馱　喃　迦(所謂一切諸法無造作)」　以是理光明，　　觀此聲實義，　摩尼寶王印，　　定、慧互相交。
translation: The ordinary seed mind truly says, "Nan mamatha pada mangan (which means all dharmas are uncreated)." With this illumination of principle, he observes the true meaning of this sound, the seal of the maṇi-jewel king, and the intersection of concentration and wisdom.

source_sentence: 一切菩薩真言曰(真言如上)。
translation: The true words of all bodhisattvas are (spoken as above).

source_sentence: 佉字含眾色，　　增加大空點，　置之於頂上，　　當得等虛空。
translation: "The Sanskrit letter kha contains many forms, which add up to a great dot of emptiness, and when placed on top of the head, it will become equal to space.

source_sentence: 復於其首內，　　想念本初字，　純白點嚴飾，　　最勝百明心。
translation: Again, within its head, he contemplates the word primordial, adorned with pure white dots, and his mind is most excellent in its one hundred insights.

source_sentence: 眼界猶明燈，　　大空無垢字，　住於本尊位，　　正覺當現前。
translation: The visual sphere is like a bright lamp, and the word for great emptiness and immaculate abides in the original position, where right awakening will be manifested.

source_sentence: 又觀彼心處，　　圓滿淨月輪，　炳現阿字門，　　遍作金剛色。
translation: He also observes the place in his mind that's completely filled with the pure moon, which clearly shows the letter a and is adamantine in color.

source_sentence: 其聲真實義，　　諸法本不生。
translation: Its sound is truly real, and all dharmas are originally unarisen.

source_sentence: 迦字以為首，　　或所持真實，　環列有圓明。
translation: The letter ka takes the lead, or it might be true as it's held, and it's arranged in a circular pattern with perfect clarity.

source_sentence: 單字與句因，　隨意而出入，　　方迺作持誦，　懈極然後已。
translation: A single word and a cause are inserted and withdrawn as they are desired, and then they're recited with care and laziness.

source_sentence: 或以真言字，　運布心月中，　　隨其深密意，　思念聲真實。
translation: Sometimes he takes a word of true language, spreads it throughout the moon of his mind, follows its profound meaning, and thinks about the truth of sound.

source_sentence: 或奉香華等，　次第修供養。
translation: They might offer incense, flowers, and so forth, cultivating offerings in order.

source_sentence: 真實事業品第五
translation: Chapter 5 of True Undertaking

source_sentence: 當如前事業，　　而自加持作，　金剛薩埵身。
translation: According to the previous task, he himself will maintain and create the body of the Vajrasattva.

source_sentence: 思惟佛、菩薩，　無量諸功德，　　於無盡眾生，　興大慈悲心。
translation: He contemplates the innumerable virtues of buddhas and bodhisattvas, and arouses great compassion for endless sentient beings.

source_sentence: 以金剛諷誦，　及餘妙言辭，　　稱歎諸如來，　真實功德。
translation: He recites the recitation of the vajrasattva and praises the true merits of the tathāgatas with his recitation of the vajras and other beautiful words.

source_sentence: 所造善迴向，　作如是願言：　　「如大覺世尊，　以所證功德，　　迴向大菩提。
translation: Returning the good deeds that they've created, they make this vow, saying, "Thus, the greatly enlightened Bhagavān uses the merits he's realized to return to great enlightenment.

source_sentence: 我今亦如是，　　以所有福聚，　與法界眾生，　　共度生死海。
translation: Now, in the same way, I will use all the merits I've accumulated to share the ocean of birth and death with sentient beings in the Dharma realm.

source_sentence: 成正遍知道，　　自利利他法，　住如來大住，　　非獨為己身。
translation: Accomplishing perfect knowledge, I will benefit myself and others by abiding in the Tathāgata's great abode, not just for myself.

source_sentence: 乃至返生死，　　濟度諸眾生，　得一切種智，　　到第一安樂，　當奉獻閼伽。」
translation: Even when he returns to birth-and-death, he'll save all sentient beings, attain knowledge of all kinds, and reach the greatest peace and happiness, and then he'll offer himself to the guardian."

source_sentence: 作歸命合掌，　置頂上思惟，　　諸佛、菩薩眾，　真實大功德，　　至誠作禮言。
translation: Putting his palms together in homage, he placed them on top of his head and reflected on the truly great merits of the buddhas and bodhisattvas, and sincerely paid homage to them.

source_sentence: 作禮偈言：「諸有永離一切過，　　無量功德莊嚴身，　一向饒益眾生者，　　我今悉皆歸命禮。」
translation: They then make a prostration in verse, saying, "All beings are forever freed from all faults, have measureless merits that adorn their bodies, and have always benefited sentient beings; now I salute them all with homage."

source_sentence: 次啟白眾聖說是偈言：「現前諸如來、　　救世諸菩薩，　不斷大乘教，　　到殊勝位者，　唯願聖天眾，　　決定證知我，　各當隨所安，　　後復垂哀赴。」
translation: Next, he revealed this verse to the sages, saying, "Tathāgatas and bodhisattvas who have saved the world, who have never abandoned the great vehicle teaching, and who have reached a superior position, may all the sages and gods decide to realize me, take refuge in me, and extend compassion to me later."

source_sentence: 次當以三昧耶真言密印於頂上解之，而生是心：「諸有結護加持皆令解脫。」
translation: Next, you should place the true seal of the samaya on your head and understand it, giving rise to the thought, "All attachments, protections, and blessings will cause liberation."

source_sentence: 以此方便故，先所奉請諸尊各還所住，不為無礙大誓之所留止也。
translation: Because of this method, the venerables whom he first invited to return to their original abodes won't be held back by the unhindered great vow.

source_sentence: 復用法界本性加持自體，思惟淨菩提心，而住金剛薩埵身，是中明印。
translation: Furthermore, when the original nature of the Dharma realm is applied to its own body, he contemplates the pure mind of enlightenment and abides in the Vajrasattva body, which is the seal of insight in the middle.

source_sentence: 前說若念誦竟，以此三印持身，所有真言行門終畢，法則皆悉圓滿。
translation: As was explained earlier, if he finishes reciting and maintains his body with these three seals, then at the end of all his true speech practices, the Dharma will be completely fulfilled.

source_sentence: 又應如前方便觀法界字以為頂相，被服金剛甲冑，由斯祕密莊嚴故，即得如金剛自性無能沮壞之者。
translation: You should also observe the word dharma-realm as the top of your head according to the preceding method and put on the vajra armor, so that because of this mysterious adornment, you'll attain the self-nature of the vajras and be unable to disrupt them.

source_sentence: 諸有聞其音聲——或見、或觸——皆必定於阿耨多羅三藐三菩提一切功德皆悉成就，與大日如來等無有異也。
translation: Anyone who hears their sounds - whether seen or touched - will surely attain the unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment, with no difference from the Tathāgata and others.

source_sentence: 次復起增上心修行殊勝事業，於清淨處嚴以香華，先令自身作觀世音菩薩、或住如來自性，依前方便以真言密印加持，然後以法施心讀誦大乘方廣經典、或以心誦，而請諸天神等令聽受之。
translation: Next, he then arouses a superior mind and cultivates an extraordinary practice by decorating a pure place with flowers and incense, first making himself become an Avalokitêśvara bodhisattva or abide in the Tathāgata's own nature, applying the seal of the true language according to the previous method, then recites the broad Mahāyāna sutras with the mind or recites them mentally with the mindfulness of giving Dharma, and invites the gods and so forth to hear and accept them.

source_sentence: 如所說偈言：「金剛頂經說，　　觀世蓮華眼，　即同一切佛，　　無盡莊嚴身。
translation: As the verse explains, "The Vajraśekhara says, 'He observes the lotus eye of the world, which is the same as all the buddhas' inexhaustibly adorned bodies.'

source_sentence: 或以世導師，　　諸法自在者，　隨取一名號，　　作本性加持。」
translation: Perhaps he takes a name from a guide of the world, someone who has mastery over the teachings, and gives it to them as a blessing of their original nature."

source_sentence: 觀自在種子心曰：「南　麼　三　曼　多　勃　馱　喃　娑(急呼)」　字門真實義，　　諸法無染著，　音聲所流出，　　當作如是觀。
translation: The Avalokitêśvara seed mind says, "Nam mamatha buddha (hurrah)," the true meaning of the word 'approach,' the lack of defiled attachment to things, and the sounds that flow from them should be observed like this.

source_sentence: 此中身密相，　　所謂蓮華印，　如前奉敷座，　　我已分別說。
translation: This is the body's esoteric form, which is called the lotus seal, which is spread out on the seat as before and which I've explained in detail.

source_sentence: 次說觀自在真言曰：「南　麼　三　曼　多　勃　馱　喃(一)　薩　嚩　怛　佗(引)蘖　多　嚩　路　吉　多(二)　羯　嚕　拏　麼　也(三)囉　囉　囉　吽　惹(四)(入)　莎　呵」前以法界心字置之在頂，又用此真言密印相加，隨力所堪讀誦經法、或造制底曼荼羅等。
translation: Next, he spoke the true words of Avalokitêśvara, "Nan mamatha buddha (a) sarva tantra (citation needed) tiller tamatha vajra (b) karuṇa maya (c) rā rā rā un jā (d) (enter) sahā".

source_sentence: 所為已畢，次從座起，以和敬相應接諸人事。
translation: After doing so, he then rises from his seat and accepts the participants with reverence and harmony.

source_sentence: 又為身輪得支持故，次行乞食，或檀越請、或僧中所得，當離魚、肉、薰菜。
translation: In order to support the body as it turns, he then begs for food, either at the invitation of a donor or from within the saṃgha, which should be free of fish, meat, and perfumed vegetables.

source_sentence: 及供養本尊諸佛之餘，乃至種種殘宿不淨、諸酒木菓等漿可以醉人者皆不應飲噉。
translation: Besides making offerings to the venerable buddhas, they shouldn't drink or eat anything leftover or impure, or liquor, wood, fruit, or other juices that could intoxicate people.

source_sentence: 次奉摶食用獻本尊，又作隨意食法，若由有餘，更出一分，為濟飢乏乞求故，當生是心：「我為任持身器安穩行道受是段食，如膏車轄令不敗傷有所至到，不應以滋味故。」
translation: Next, when you dedicate a handful of food to the Bhagavān and make a random offering, if there's any left, then you'll give another portion to help those who are hungry and seeking, so you'll give rise to this thought, "I accept this food for the purpose of maintaining my body as a container and walking stably on the path, like anointing a chariot so that it won't spoil and I'll reach something, not because of its taste."

source_sentence: 增減其心及生悅澤嚴身之想，然後觀法界心字遍淨諸食，以事業金剛加持自身。
translation: After increasing and decreasing their minds and generating the perception of a pleasant, lustrous body, they then contemplate the word dharma realm mind pervading and purifying foods, and they adorn themselves with the vajra of works.

source_sentence: 是中種子如鑁字真言所說，復誦施十力明八遍，方乃食之。
translation: The seeds in question eat after reciting the instructions for giving the ten powers eight times, just as the true words of the ϵāntika say.

source_sentence: 說此明曰：「南　麼　薩　婆　勃　馱　菩　提　薩　埵　南(一)　唵麼　蘭　捺　泥(去)　帝　孺　忙　栗　寗(二)　莎　訶」如是住，先成就本尊瑜伽。
translation: He says, "Nan masa buddha bodhisattva nan (a) o mam ala nir (go) ti tu bzang lul khan (b) sahā" and thus abides, first accomplishing the yoga of the original image.

source_sentence: 飯食訖已，所餘觸食以成辦諸事真言心供養所應食者。
translation: After finishing his meal, he then makes offerings to those who deserve it with the remaining food that he touches with the intention of accomplishing various tasks in words of truth.

source_sentence: 當用不空威怒增加，聖不動真言當誦一遍，受者歡喜，常隨行人與護念之。
translation: You should increase it with the invisible wrath, and you should recite the holy immovable truth once, rejoicing in those who accept it and always following those who practice and guard it.

source_sentence: 彼真言曰：「南　麼　三　曼　多　伐　折囉(引、二合)　赧(一)　怛囉(二合)吒(輕)　阿　謨　伽(二)　戰　荼　摩　訶　路　沙儜(上)(三)　娑破(二合)　吒　野　吽(四)　怛囉(二合)　麼野(五)　怛囉(二合)　麼　野(六)　吽(七)　怛囉(二合)　吒(輕)(八)悍　漫(九)」彼食竟休息少時，復當禮拜諸佛、懺悔眾罪。
translation: He says, "Nam mamatha vajra(c), māyā(e), māyā(f), māyā(g), māyā(g), māyā(g), māyā(g), māyā(g), māyā(g), māyā(g), māyā(h), māyā(h), māyā(h), māyā(h), māyā(h), māyā(h), and māyā(h)." After he finishes eating, he should then venerate the buddhas and repent of his sins while resting for a short time.

source_sentence: 為淨心故，如是修常業，乃至依前誦讀經典。
translation: For the sake of purifying their minds, they thus cultivate their regular activities, even reciting the sūtras in accordance with the previous ones.

source_sentence: 恒依是住，於後日分亦復如是，初夜、後夜思惟大乘無得間絕。
translation: Continuously abiding in this way, he also does the same in the latter part of the day, contemplating the great vehicle without break in the early and latter portions of the night.

source_sentence: 至中夜分以事業金剛如前，被金剛甲敬禮一切諸佛、大菩薩等。
translation: At the midnight hour, he takes the vajra for work as before, puts on his vajra armor, and venerates all the buddhas and great bodhisattvas.

source_sentence: 次當運心如法供養，而作是念：「我為一切眾生志求大事因緣故，應當覆護是身，少時安寢，非為貪著睡眠之樂。」
translation: Next, you should make offerings according to the teaching and think, "For the sake of all sentient beings seeking the cause and conditions of greatness, I should guard this body and sleep soundly for a short time, not for the pleasure of craving sleep."

source_sentence: 先當正身威儀，重累二足，右脇而臥。
translation: First, you should correct your body's manner, put on your two feet, and lay down on your right side.

source_sentence: 若支體疲懈者，隨意轉側無咎，為令速寤，常當係意在明。
translation: If his limbs and body are lazy, he'll turn to his side as he wishes without fault, but in order to wake up quickly, he should always keep his mind focused on awareness.

source_sentence: 又復不應偃臥床上，次於餘日亦如是行之。
translation: Again, he shouldn't lie down on his bed, and then he'll do the same on other days.

source_sentence: 持真言者以不虧法則無間勤修，故得真言門修菩薩行之名號也。
translation: Because he doesn't lack the principle of continuity and diligence, a true-word holder attains the name of a bodhisattva who cultivates the practice of the true-word approach.

source_sentence: 若於數時相現等持誦法中作前方便，乃至具修勝業猶不成就者，應自警悟，倍加精進，勿得生下劣相而言：「是法非我所堪。」
translation: If someone does the previous method of reciting the Dharma with several time-period appearances or so forth, and even when they've cultivated excellent actions, they still haven't accomplished it, they should police themselves, redouble their efforts, and not give rise to inferior appearances and say, "This teaching is beyond my abilities."

source_sentence: 如是展其志力，自利、利他，常不空過。
translation: Thus, they must apply their determination and energy for their own benefit and for the benefit of others, always without fail.

source_sentence: 以行者懃誠不休息故，眾聖玄照其心，則蒙威神建立，得離諸障。
translation: Because practitioners strive sincerely without resting, the sages illuminate their minds profoundly, and their authority and spirit are established, enabling them to avoid the hindrances.

source_sentence: 是中有二事不應捨離：謂不捨諸佛菩薩、及饒益無盡眾生心。
translation: Of these, there are two things that shouldn't be abandoned: not abandoning the buddhas and bodhisattvas and the mind to benefit endless sentient beings.

source_sentence: 恒於一切智願心不傾動，此因緣必定得成，隨類悉地也。
translation: When he's constantly unmoved by the vow of omniscience, this cause and condition will surely be fulfilled, and he'll attain the stage of accomplishment according to type.

source_sentence: 常依內法而澡浴，　　不應執著外淨法，　於觸食等懷疑悔，　　如是皆所不應為。
translation: He always relies on internal things to bathe, so he shouldn't cling to external pure things and has doubts about touching food and so forth, which should never be done.

source_sentence: 若為任持是身故，　　隨時盥沐除諸垢，　於河流等如法教，　　與真言印共相應。
translation: If this is the reason he maintains this body, he'll wash himself at appropriate times to remove defilements, teaching as the Dharma in rivers and so forth, and coinciding with the seal of the true language.

source_sentence: 以法界心淨諸水，　　隨用不動降三世，　真言密印護方等，　　住於本尊自性觀。
translation: He purifies the waters with the mind of the Dharma realm, uses them in an unmoving way to subdue the three worlds, protects the directions with the dharma-mudrā, and abides in the self-conception of the original honored one.

source_sentence: 復當三轉持淨土，　　恒以一心正思惟，　念聖不動真言等，　　智者默然應澡浴。
translation: Again, he should hold the Pure Land in three turns, constantly contemplate it with a single mind, and remember the noble, immovable true words, etc., as wise men silently take a bath.

source_sentence: 淨法界心、不動尊種子、刀印皆如前說。
translation: The pure mind of the Dharma realm, the seeds of the Acala, and the sword seal are all as explained above.

source_sentence: 降三世種子心曰：「南　麼　三　曼　多　伐　折囉　赧　南　涸」　此中訶字門，　　聲理如前說，　少分差別者，　　所謂淨除相。
translation: The subduing mind of the seeds of the three worlds says, "Nam mamatha vajra, haila, and nam kan." This is the approach of the letter ha, which sounds like the principle explained above and has a few distinctions, which are called the characteristic of purity and removal.

source_sentence: 降伏三界尊，　　身密之儀式，　當用成事業，　　五智金剛印。
translation: It's a ritual for subduing the honored ones in the three realms, a body mystic, which should be used to accomplish deeds, and the vajra seal of the five kinds of wisdom.

source_sentence: 次說降三世真言曰：「南　麼　三　曼　多　伐　日囉　赧(一)　訶　訶　訶(二)微　薩麼(二合)　曳(平)(三)　薩　婆　怛　他(引)　蘖　多微　灑　也　三　婆　嚩(四)　怛囇(二合)　路　枳也(二合)微　惹　也(五)　吽　惹(急呼、二合)　莎　訶」　如是澡浴灑淨已，　　具三昧耶護支分，　思惟無量聖天眾，　　三奉掬水而獻之。
translation: He then says, "Nam mamatha vajra blush (1) ha ha ha ha (2) we sama (2) hai (2) (3) sarvattha (citation needed) tiller tama we saya sarvattha (4) tamatha (2) lu kiya (2) we jaya (5) un jaya (2) sahā". After bathing and purifying himself in this way, he takes refuge in the protective arm of the samaya, contemplates the measureless multitude of sages and gods, and offers them three bowls of water.

source_sentence: 為淨身心利他故，　　敬禮如來勝生子，　遠離三毒分別等，　　寂調諸根詣精室。
translation: For the purpose of purifying body and mind for the benefit of others, he pays homage to the Tathāgata's surpassing sons, secludes himself from the three poisons and discriminations, and calmly tames his faculties as he travels to the abode of fine water.

source_sentence: 或依水室異方便，　　心住如前所制儀，　自身三等為限量，　　為求上、中、下法故。
translation: He might rely on a different method for the water chamber, abide in his mind according to the previously prescribed ritual, and limit himself to three levels in order to seek the higher, middle, and lower dharmas.

source_sentence: 行者如是作持誦，　　所有罪流當永息，　必定成就推諸障，　　一切智句集其身。
translation: When practitioners thus observe and recite it, the flow of sins will be permanently stopped, the hindrances will surely be removed, and all the phrases of wisdom will be collected in their bodies.

source_sentence: 彼依世間成就品，　　或復餘經之所說，　供養支分眾方便，　　如其次第所修行。
translation: Relying on the teachings of the worldly achievements or other scriptures, he makes offerings in various ways, cultivating them in their order.

source_sentence: 未離有為諸相故，　　是謂世間之悉地，　次說無相最殊勝，　　具信解者所觀察。
translation: Because they haven't yet parted with the marks of existence, this is called the worldly attainment, followed by the most excellent explanation of marklessness, which is observed by those who have faith and understanding.

source_sentence: 若真言乘深慧人，　　此生志求無上果，　隨所信解修觀照，　　如前心供養之儀。
translation: If someone of profound wisdom from the vehicle of the truth wants to pursue the unsurpassed result in this life, they cultivate their faith and understanding and contemplate it according to their previous rituals of mental offerings.

source_sentence: 及依悉地流出品、　　出世間品瑜伽法，　彼於真實緣生句，　　內心支分離攀緣。
translation: Relying on the yogâcārabhūmi and supramundane qualities that arise from the stream of accomplishment, he discerns the true and real conditions that arise and the internal mental factors that free him from attachments.

source_sentence: 依此方便而修證，　　當得出世間成就。
translation: Cultivating this method, they'll attain supramundane attainment.

source_sentence: 如所說優陀那偈言：「甚深無相法，　　劣慧所不堪，　為應彼等故，　　兼存有相說。」
